_BTW, I never knew you were a conjoined twin... ;-)_   
   
Heh... Yeah. I've got two systems hooked up to the same monitor/keyboard/mouse through a switchbox (just below the screen). That way I can switch between OSX on the laptop (with dual screens) and OS9 on the Cube (for FOG work mainly). Not a bad compromise and it saves desk space.

I meant your chair. :-)   
   
hhp

Oh, _that._ Very funny. Well, have you ever seen the old Python skit about the man with three buttocks? It looks like it was maybe designed for somebody like him, doesn't it? Actually, it's just supposed to be better for your back.

I don't have any pictures of my present work area. When I started working from home most of the time, I colonised the dining room table. We have not had a dinner party for two years now.   
   
I still keep an office in a building downtown, but only go there once or twice a week. I keep it because I don't have anywhere at home to store more than a small fraction of the library (the dining table is now surrounded by stacks of books related to current projects). The office looks like its been wrapped by Cristo: a couple of years back, a small fire elsewhere in the building caused sprinklers to go off on six floors, causing a huge amount of damage. My floor wasn't affected, but now I'm paranoid and have wrapped all my bookcases in heavy-duty plastic. If you want a book, you have to crawl under the plastic to retrieve it.   
   
I need to move to a bigger apartment, or a house, so I can set up a proper home-office and bring my books.   
   
If all this sounds inconvenient and uncomfortable, it's not so bad, and I have an Aeron chair. It only seats the usual number of buttocks, but is extremely comfortable.

I don't have a digital camera, my 35-mm SLR was stolen in   
San Francisco two weeks ago, and my APS SLR has no film...   
   
I'm on an old maple-wood dinner table on one side of the bedroom, facing glass doors to the backyard. Scanner on the left, laptop in the middle (flanked by speakers), printer on the right. Scanner stacked with papers and crap (yes, I know it's bad for it). Part of my books are on shelves to the left, part on my bedside table, most in a closet upstairs. Close your eyes and work with me here.   
   
Oh, and a plunger always handy.
